title: Olivia Dean Wins Big at the Brit Awards in Manchester
summary: Olivia Dean is a singer from London who won four awards at the Brit Awards, a big music show in the UK. This year, the awards were held in Manchester for the first time instead of London. She won best British artist, best album, song of the year, and best pop act. Her album is called The Art of Loving and has songs about love. At the show, she performed her song Man I Need and was very happy. Other singers like Harry Styles and Rosalía also performed. Rosalía won an award for music in a different language, and Rosé was the first K-Pop singer to win a Brit Award. Olivia Dean is becoming a famous star in Britain.

background_read: The Brit Awards are a yearly music awards show in the UK that celebrate the best British and international music. They started in 1977 and are usually held in London, but this year they moved to Manchester for the first time. Olivia Dean is a young singer from London who has become popular with her songs about love. Winning four awards at the Brits is a big achievement and shows she is a rising star in pop music.
Article_Structure: WHO: Olivia Dean, a singer from London, and other artists like Rosalía and Rosé.
WHAT: Olivia Dean won four awards at the Brit Awards, including best British artist and best album.
WHERE: The awards were held in Manchester, England, for the first time.
WHY: To celebrate the best music in the UK and show support for different cultures and languages.
